item.name: UI
item.description: UI for subsystems, users, roles, actions management

item.name: Actions from subsystem
item.description: Subsystem is able to send its actions to the Superfly server

item.name: Spring Security integration
item.description: To use Superfly security (authentication/authorization) in your application you only need to use a Superfly module for Spring Security

item.name: SSL integration
item.description: Subsystem may be authenticated to the Superfly server using a client SSL authentication

item.name: Demo application
item.description: All features (including Spring security integration and SSL integration) are demonstrated by a Demo application

item.name: Local mode
item.description: Local mode for Spring Security integration allows to develop your application more easily with no requirement to interact with a Superfly server

item.name: Spring 3.0 support
item.description: Some internal classes are changed to work with Spring 3.0. superfly-spring-security artifact now works with Spring Security 3.0, while legacy artifact working with Spring Security 2.0.x was moved to superfly-spring-security-2.0.

item.name: Jira integration
item.description: It's possible to configure Jira to use Superfly as a security provider.

item.name: UI enhancements
item.description: UI is made a bit more friendly.

item.name: UI enhancements
item.description: Actions are sorted by name in lists. Filters are made sticky.

item.name: PCI-DSS requirements
item.description: Superfly is modified to comply to PCI-DSS requirements. See further tasks for details.

item.name: Password encryption
item.description: Passwords in database are encrypted. Salt is supported. All MesageDigest algorithms available via JRE are supported for hashing.

item.name: Password expiration
item.description: Passwords may be configured to be expired with time.

item.name: Accounts suspension
item.description: User accounts may be configured to be suspended after a period of inactivity.

item.name: PCI-DSS password restrictions
item.description: Restrictions like minimal password length, mixed letters and digits, not matching to recently used passwords may be configured to be applied.

item.name: Password reset
item.description: Password reset may be carried out in accordance to PCI-DSS.

item.name: Two-factor authentication
item.description: Two-factor authentication is supported on spring-security side by new module structure for authentication workflow. Server-side, infrastructure for One-Time Passwords is created and ready for providers to be plugged in.
